snippet: The trial of two former aides to Comptroller John C. Liu went to the jury after lawyers portrayed them as victims of prosecutorial zeal.
abstract: Lawyers for Jia Hou and Xing Wu Pan, former associates of New York City Comptroller John C Liu, ask jury to acquit their clients of conspiring in illegal campaign finance scheme to benefit Liu; argue that Hou had no knowledge of scheme and that Pan was pressured into it.
lead_paragraph: The trial of two former aides to Comptroller John C. Liu went to the jury after lawyers portrayed them as victims of prosecutorial zeal.

headline.seo: Fraud Trial of Ex-Aides to John C. Liu Goes to Jury
headline.main: Defense in Fraud Trial Blames Failed U.S. Effort to Charge Liu
headline.print_headline: Defense in Fraud Trial Blames Failed U.S. Effort to Charge Liu
